intro: Arrabidaea mollis, commonly known as the velvet tamarind, is a species of flowering plant in the Fabaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, and is characterized by its distinctive, velvety, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Arrabidaea mollis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
